job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Lynchburg, VA
pros: Coworkers that care and help contribute to the team, attendance policy is pretty manageable even as a mom of two small kids, ED management is decent and cares for its employees; consistent, reliable, and SAFE resources readily available for patient care, good PTO accrual, you can make your own schedule, good orientation as a new grad (20 weeks), autonomous nature of RN position and what they allow us to do to begin treating our patients before a doctor can come see them is nice and not found in a lot of other hospital systems.
cons: Poor upper management that seems to only care about money, poor HR policies including no sick time given for employees, less than ideal safe staffing at times- one night there were only 3 RN’s scheduled to staff a whole ER so management had to beg for help and make it up as the day went on, lower pay than most hospital systems in the state, lost about 30 nurses over 4-5 months when covid began and staff was not replenished as management placed a hiring freeze, management/charge nurses/admins are more helpful to certain favorites in the department than other non-favorites, night shift staffing is abysmal.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Lynchburg, VA
pros: The overwhelming majority of nurses there truly want to  make a difference and to care for their patients.  They've made some great patient-oriented changes, like with dietary menu.
cons: Staff cuts have made this a less than favorable environment to work and pt safety is at risk.  If there aren't shortages, then nurses shouldn't be REQUIRED to work additional 8 or more hours.  You cannot give "excellent care every time" without the support of management.  Some areas are much stronger in this respect than others.  Not keeping seasoned nurses.  It is NOT a salary issue!  New grads, do yourself a favor.  Before you go into a high pressure, high stress area, like ER or critical care, get a year of nursing experience.  It goes a long way in helping to prevent burnout and realize that you have chosen a difficult field and the reality of it is hard!  Don't precept with someone who just graduated last year.  Chances are, she's still learning too!

pros: Challenging work, nothing routine, puzzles
cons: Overwhelming problems, multiple systems issues, no support, unorganized, bad work environment

pros: I really enjoy working with my patients and my coworkers are the best!
cons: Too many administrative changes in the past 6 months.

pros: This is a Magnet facility so it is considered a cut above. Most of the region's traumas come to us unless there is a treatment or specialty unit Roanoke or UVA can offer that we cannot. It's a large hospital compared to the size of the town. Centra tries to engage its employees and offer perks like free or discounted movie tickets.
cons: Centra works its nurses and doctors pretty hard. The hours for nurses are self-scheduled but there is a hospital-wide mandatory 24 hours overtime per 6 week period due to a nursing shortage. They tend to take financial shortcuts, like hiring temporary travel nurses to make up for high turnover (which are much more expensive) instead of finding ways to keep their current employees more satisfied. At times, it's obvious that the policies are created by people nowhere near the bedside, so they are impractical. Pay is not competitive given the proximity to Richmond. Because of these things, retention is an area in which Centra continues to struggle.

pros: The Emergency Room healthcare team
cons: Management, lack of resources and support from higher ups

review_title: Experience varies depending on which unit you work on
pros: Most of your co-workers are compassionate, dedicated, and care about patient care. There are many units within both hospitals that are exceptional. Many intelligent and talented nurses and therapists work here.
cons: Too many mid-level directors and VPs that do not understand how productivity should work, therefore, unrealistic caseload expectations, high turn-over, and poor work-life balance. The culture here does not promote evidenced-based practice, despite their claims that they do (at least in the therapy departments) because they do not allow the time, money, or a top-down approach to encourage best practice vs "this is the way we've always done it."

pros:
Steady income.
Kind, caring, friendly employees from EVERY department in the hospital.
Most of my own department coworkers are amazing!
I NEVER have to work there again!
cons:
Pay as compared to other large healthcare companies in our area.
Incompetent management in the department that I left. I understand this is not an isolated problem at Centra.
Lack of job security as fear of being fired every day per MANY current  and former (including myself) employees.
Lack of support for staff from said managers.
My former managers were vindictive and unprofessional on many occasions.

review_title: Below-par working conditions to match below-par pay
pros: Flexible scheduling at times, some supportive management, ok benefits, fast-paced days that makes work time goes by faster (due to the nurse/patient ratio, you're ALWAYS drowning in your work), physicians are great to work alongside, centra attempts to become active in the community and outlying areas
cons: mandatory overtime, removal of early commitment bonus for extra hours an employee would sign up for before schedule was made.  Opportunities for advancement were very political, even if the right candidate was "clear as day."  HR was very difficult to work for and would also not back up an employee when faced with a work dilemma. Be prepared to "do more with less."  Seems as though more marketing was done to attract new nurses rather than satisfy current employees.  Centra nurses are stretched very thin and expected to do all and act in all roles with a micro-managed smile on their face to give "excellent care, every time."

pros: Good opportunity for learning with diverse group o patients.  Will assist with tuition costs
cons: In my unit, there were people who were chosen to be the leaders, experience means nothing.  Unit manager cannot be trusted.  Plays staff against each other. Leads by scare tactics. Cute nurses with lustful eyes, are the only ones valued by physicians.  Mangers have no leadership or communication skills.  Recently new RN hired without interview because she was related to a supervisor and said she loved UM and thought she was fun.  RN found to be lazy and clueless. Multiple surveys sent to evaluate unit managers but nothing was done.  Um only hires church friends and  uses them as source of information and to report petty findings to UM

job_title: Special Education Teacher, Secondary School in Covington, VA
pros:
Benefits package is competitive.
School was within reasonable commute from my home.
School was in close proximity to both County and city law enforcement.
cons:
Hostile work environment due to students acting out with ineffective consequences.
Actions of principal and staff do not match stated mission and goals for preparing students academically to reenter public schools. Approach to managing students could be described as fostering and promoting learned helplessness instead of self-accountable  learners. Older Students too reliant on mental health counselors for every little thing.  The counselors in my classroom frequently corrected my attempts to manage classroom and did so in front of students. Principal took counselors' side in issues which I brought to his attention. His response to my input or suggestions was "yeah, yeah, yeah." Very dismissive attitude.

pros: I am a part time intern in information services or the MIS office. All the employees are really smart and understand what they are doing. I have learned a lot here as well. The staff is all very friendly and patient. Every employee, even a low level intern gets a office.
cons: It doesn't seem like there is a lot of room for growth. I haven't seen any new people sense I have started and only one person has left sense i have started. although every one gets a office, a lot of the offices lack a window and you tend to loose track of the day. You leave the building some days thinking, "what year is it."

review_title: Look elsewhere for a scribe position
pros: coworkers are nice. in depth understanding of the ER, if that's what you're interested in. Otherwise, might actually be a con.
cons: So much work for very little pay. Also not very rewarding since you're looking at a laptop screen all day instead of at the patients. At least for me, training was sink or swim. System for doing your job is not as efficient as it could be.

review_title: My experience at LGH was good, rewarding and satisfying.
pros: I enjoy having what I need to work with; liked working weekend nights. Teamwork was great on nights.
cons: At times, we would have to go from one med room to the other to get supplies or medications.  So when talking about time management and efficiency, this issue is a great example of wasting valuable patient and charting time.

review_title: Bad EMR choice for recent upgrade.
pros: Decent benefits and vacation time.
cons: With recent EMR upgrade to Cerna, there has been a number of employees leaving the hospital/outlying offices due to the poor functionality of the system.  This includes staff from all levels, including providers.  Con #2-poor management in my setting contributed to my resigning from the practice as well.

pros: With the right attitude and positive work ethic, you can make a difference with Centra, at all levels of the organization. Management is always open to listen to suggestions.
cons: Pay scale is relative to area, and high tech jobs pay below market value.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Lynchburg, VA
pros: If you know the 'right people', you can occasionally obtain a decent wage. Some people actually do seem to care about their subordinates (although the number is fairly limited). If you don't have much of a life outside of work, then this is the job for you. Advancement is possible IF you're willing to cut someone else's throat. Sleeping with management can advance your cause. Knowing one of the higher ups has its advantages.
cons: Awful management. Poor organizational priorities. They are more concerned about how much profit they can bill out, trim from employees or how many green low paid 'bodies' they can employ at a higher profit margin. Many backstabbers in both management and regular employees. They take your built up time and make it practically impossible to use. Very abusive atmosphere when it comes to treating long term employees well. Almost like they're more interested in trading off experienced nurses in lieu of cheaper, less experienced ones (again, for profit margins). Patient safety/care is poor and one nurse doesn't know what the next nurse is/was doing. Too many shift changes places patient care on a pretty low scale. Little regard for existing employees and their concerns (IE, pay, time off, incentives,etc). Vastly understaffed. Managers do little more than delegate tasks, irrespective of whether or not they are capable of said tasks. They put on a big 'show' when Joint Commission shows up, hiding violations, making employees lie. Lots of overtime hours (especially if you're salaried). Doesn't do much for ones' morale. High stress, little reward. Managers take credit for other people's work.

review_title: Higher ups are oblivious, but general management is great
job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Lynchburg, VA
pros: Unit manager was a great leader and advocate, professional work environment, decent health and dental package, and great scholarship opportunities.
cons: CEO and higher ups are completely out of touch with the needs of the average employee, constant changes to policy and software that seem to add more trouble to our job than help, and pay isn't worth the amount of work you put in.

job_title: Respiratory Care Practitioner in Farmville, VA
pros: The Pros of this job is that I had the opportunity to to work with infant,pediatric and adult patients as far as putting patient on High flow device to bipap and ventilators
cons: The cons of the job is there's only two therapist to a shift covering the whole entire hospital but the staff work together to make sure everything has been covered and taking care of.

pros: Education Opportunities. Scheduling/Position. Most everyone is willing to help.
cons: Advancement process is rigorous and not worth the time/effort. Frequent change in policies. Lack of communication. Lack of support from Management. Lack of parking. Low base pay.

pros:
They pay attention to employee issues
There are better opportunities for advancement
The pay is decent
They insist on employees providing customer service to patient clients, that's a wonderful thing in light of these days of "no customer service".
Lynchburg, va is a great town!!
cons:
You don't earn vacation time as well as other companies
The health insurance provided is not as good as other health care systems--expensive out of pocket--if you have to use it

job_title: Speech Language Pathologist in Lynchburg, VA
pros: Interns are exposed to multiple disciplines and have the opportunity to observe many healthcare settings related to speech-language pathology. Interns are provided with ample experience in a variety of necessary medical SLP skills. All therapy disciplines were dedicated to the success and recovery of their patients.
cons: At times it was a difficult work environment. Therapy disciplines and management were segmented and occasionally oppositional, which caused for this difficult work environment. SLP caseloads were large in comparison to other therapy disciplines.

pros: You will learn to multitask as there is a severe lack of staff !!!!!
cons: Doesn't pay near what other health care systems pay, severely understaffed, will do anything to keep a nickle from you, management doesn't doesnabot the patients or the employees, health insurance is awful, and the employee turnover rate is off the charts obviously because of what I mentioned earlier.

pros: I had the best supervisor I could ever ask for!
cons: Rude coworkers!They easily forget that they were once a new phlebotomist. Those perfect phlebotomists are the same ones that tear the top of their gloves off so they can feel for a vein, sticks a patient with the same needle twice and talks rude to the patient. I hate that I let them run me off from a job that I loved!

pros: I have found that comparatively speaking the benefits are good.  I have the opportunity for self scheduling that offers a flexible schedule.
cons: Centra is a very large organization and sometimes it seems as if the people who work for them are forgotten while they are focused on growing the company.

pros: Good place to work; great culture and co-workers; great benefits; good experience because you are able to touch a lot of different accounting areas; flexibility in what time you get to work/leave as long as you are working 40 hours
cons: Understaffed; work load is heavy at times requiring more than 40 hour work weeks; unbalanced division of work- Top performers have more work assigned to them; current structure does not allow room to advance

pros: Centra is one of the leading employers in the Central Virginia region, and they provide excellent job security to their employees
cons: The payscale is below the national average for the positions that they fill.  There was one instance where we went two years without even cost of living raises, and the company sent out an email thanking employees for all their hardwork in aiding Centra to have one of its best financial years

review_title: Great place to work,  and several opportunities to grow in the company.
pros: Pay, work schedule is wonderful, management is great, family oriented and good benefits, continuing education is offered at little or no cost.
cons: I really can’t think of any. Some individuals use Centra as a stepping stone for city or county EMS, that is changing. People are coming to Centra to stay. So now it’s not a negative.

job_title: Special Education Teacher in Fredericksburg, VA
pros: I love my job. Centra Health has great benefits and is very accommodating to employee's needs.
cons: I am currently living in Northern Virginia and while I love my company, my husband get out of the service next may and we plan to move closer to home.

review_title: Generally a Good place to work
pros: Tons of employee support. Managers really care about the employees. Good benefits overall. Team work practiced here as well.   Will recommend!!
cons: Too many employee engagement surveys and additional surveys to file. At times can be difficult to get to some of the senior management. A few of the employees are not about teamwork

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Lynchburg, VA
pros: As a counselor your skills and training really get put to the test.
cons: Not employee oriented company. Pay is below average and there are few opportunities for advancement within.

pros: Decent paid time off. Really busy so your time goes by quick. Education services.
cons: Pay is awful. Environment is mentally toxic. Understaffed constantly.

review_title: Centra Specialty Hospital. Great hospital, great team
pros: Great teamwork, decent benefits. The nurses on night shift are amazing, always willing to lend a hand and help out. This is my first hospital job after LTC/SNF and I love.
cons: Very busy floor, not for the faint of heart. Not very good bonus pay and mandatory extra hours every schedule.

pros: Variety of projects and services to work with. Many of the people were good to work with. My own coworker were great!
cons: Unorganized leadership and lack of basic business and strategic planning. Lots of politics and low pay except for Administration.

review_title: Rehab Management Doesn’t Care About Employees or Patients
pros: The therapists themselves are good and actually care about their patients.
cons: Unreasonable productivity requirements requiring therapists to document at home at all hours, demanding extra work without financial compensation; management requests that therapists fraudulently bill to improve the numbers; what management says, goes, staff therapists are allowed zero input; if you dissent in any way you will be fired and HR won’t back you up; management does not care about patients, only their money

pros: Patient first, Absolutely does everything possible to adhere to all federal and state regulations from patient care, safety and finances.  Always looking for a better way.
cons: Salary is not the most competitive,

job_title: Emergency Medical Technician in Lynchburg, VA
pros: Pros are only limited to the fact that they are usually hired and good for local jobs, does not pay competitively for any job offers when compared to other cities.
cons: You are either overworked or called off of work, there really is not much of an in between. Pay is pretty bad.
